pullRequest.body:
Assuming a topological space `X` is completely regular and T0, it can be embedded into `ProbabilityMeasure X`. This shows in particular that for the Lévy-Prokhorov metrizability #11549 of `ProbabilityMeasure X`, certain assumptions cannot be relaxed. For example we have:

```lean
import Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Measure.DiracProba

variable {Ω : Type*} [MeasurableSpace Ω] [TopologicalSpace Ω] [OpensMeasurableSpace Ω] [T0Space Ω] [CompletelyRegularSpace Ω]

open TopologicalSpace

example :
    ¬ MetrizableSpace Ω → ¬ MetrizableSpace (ProbabilityMeasure Ω) := by
  intro badSpace goodProba
  exact badSpace embedding_diracProba.metrizableSpace

example :
    ¬ PseudoMetrizableSpace Ω → ¬ PseudoMetrizableSpace (ProbabilityMeasure Ω) := by
  intro badSpace goodProba
  exact badSpace embedding_diracProba.pseudoMetrizableSpace

example :
    ¬ FirstCountableTopology Ω → ¬ FirstCountableTopology (ProbabilityMeasure Ω) := by
  intro badSpace goodProba
  exact badSpace embedding_diracProba.firstCountableTopology
```

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body: :v: kkytola can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

> bors d+ Thanks, that looks good. Sorry for the long delay between reviews.

Thanks for the reviews! No worries about the delay, I understand everyone is busy and reviewing takes real time and energy!

I now get a lint failure because of the too long `BorelSpace.Basic` file. I have proposed a split in #12470. Should that be addressed first?
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9165537795/job/25199196378)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9165537795/job/25199195728)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9165537795/job/25199195940)

bors d+
Thanks, that looks good. Sorry for the long delay between reviews.

bors d+
Thanks, that looks good. Sorry for the long delay between reviews.

This is an added import, to be able to state `dirac_ne_dirac` in the natural generality, i.e., assuming `MeasurableSpace.SeparatesPoints`.

If the import creep is unacceptable, I see the options:
 * move the general `dirac_ne_dirac` to a different (later) file than `Dirac.lean` (one option is the new `DiracProba.lean`), and possibly state a version here with suboptimal hypotheses that do not require new imports, such as `MeasurableSingletonClass`;
 * move `MeasurableSpace.SeparatesPoints` out of `CountablyGenerated.lean` (in fact its current placement does not appear very natural to me, would it be better to have a separate "typeclasses for measurable spaces" file with `MeasurableSingletonClass`, `SeparatesPoints`, etc?).

I think this added import is fine: you are not adding much, and indeed you want to be able to use SeparatesPoints because that's the right generality.

I also agree that SeparatesPoints could be moved to another file.

Our naming convention wants that name instead:
```suggestion
instance separatesPointsOfOpensMeasurableSpaceOfT0Space [T0Space α] :
```
I think it's quite unreadable and yours would be better, but that discussion should happen elsewhere and for now we should follow the naming convention.
Can you add an `iff` version of this one?
A lemma that gives `x = y` from `dirac x = dirac y` could also be useful. That's what you need in `injective_diracProba` for example.
This looks generally useful and not specific to Dirac measures. Is there an earlier file about bounded continuous functions where it would fit?

I agree that would be desirable. But I have not found a great place. For example:
 * `Mathlib.Topology.UrysohnsBounded` does not `import Mathlib.Topology.CompletelyRegular`, so placing this there would cause a bit of import creep and this is not strictly Urysohn's lemma (although somewhat similar)
 * `Mathlib.Topology.CompletelyRegular` does not `import Mathlib.Topology.ContinuousFunction.Bounded`, so placing this there would cause a bit of import creep. This lemma is, however, quite literally a rephrasing of the property `CompletelyRegularSpace`.

Adding one of the above imports would be a possible approach, if some import creep is acceptable. Creating yet another file would be another approach, but for a single lemma this seems questionable.

I feel like I have also before scattered some results about bounded continuous functions in different files because of similar import-hierarchy problems. I have earlier even created the files:
 * `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.Integral.BoundedContinuousFunction` for integration results for bounded continuous functions.
 * `Mathlib.MeasureTheory.HasOuterApproxClosed` which contains an essentially topological property which is however meant to be used in measure theory context.

If there was a more appropriate file in the topology folder (the above ones are in the measure theory folder), a few lemmas from those files could almost certainly also be moved there. 

For the moment, however, I don't see great solutions. Perhaps a subsequent PR could address the organization of such lemmas. (Maybe also the `section NonnegativePart` that I added in `Mathlib.Totology.ContinuousFunction.Bounded` could be split off from the main bounded continuous function file.) Unfortunately the necessary imports in each of these case are slightly different, so I still don't quite know what would be the best organization.
I merged master so as to get #12559. Having the subtraction of `NNReal`-valued bounded continuous functions makes this lemma significantly shorter (it addresses the TODO I had in the proof).
You could generalize this one to use a SeparatesPoints hypothesis.

The name of a def should not contain `_` but should be camelCase instead. I see in the docs that many homeomorphs are called with a name in the namespace, like `Homeomorph.diracProba`. Other options would be `homeomorphDiracProba` or `diracProbaHomeomorph`.

Thanks! The last option you suggested seems the most natural to me, so I will go with it now. (The `Homeomorph` namespace does not seem to gain any dot notation in this case, and seems more suitable for general results rather than the very specific homeomorphism here.)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: Embed a space into probability measures on it.
